Phase 1:

Disaster Relief

Global Empowerment Mission in partnership with BStrong responded in the first phase, disaster relief, by providing millions of articles of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) to hundreds of facilities.

FACILITIES SERVICED

  • Hospitals and Clinics: 477+
  • Police and Fire Depts: 26
  • Nursing Homes: 50
  • State Health Depts 8
  • Funeral Homes: 4
  • Military: 7 bases
  • Other: 50+

FINANCIAL GRANTS

  • State of Arizona $500,000.00
  • Medstar Health Systems $500,000.00
  • Inova Health $200,000.00
  • State of Indiana $150,000.00

Total Grants disbursed: $1,350,000.00
On behalf Verstandig Family Foundation Grant

CASH CARDS

  • Wrigley/ Rockefeller: $132,000.00
  • NYC Moms $12,000.00

Phase 2

The Gap Period​

Global Empowerment Mission in partnership with BStrong is currently in the second phase, the gap period, by

  • Distribution of Bstrong cash cards to those severely impacted by the covid-19 pandemic in the US.
  • Launched its Back-to-School initiative (see below)
  • Distributing “Back-to-School” kits containing hand sanitizer, masks and corona kits

GEM Impact

  • Delivered 1,728 bottles of hand sanitizer, 4,400 masks and 100 BStrong Corona Kits to the Broward County School Board making sure 241 schools in Broward County are prepared to protect students when in school classes return

If you are a school faculty member that would like to request PPE for your school and are located in the United States click here.

If you are a medical service provider, first responder or frontline worker that would like to request PPE  for your team located in the United States click here.

excerpt.rendered: Due to the lack of PPE in the marketplace, BStrong Gem is working directly with manufacturers and distributors to ensure the necessary items are sent to people and hospitals across the nation. We have already serviced 612 facilities nationwide. This initial program will run till December 2020.
